titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Alburtus Photograph Collection Documenting Life at Yale
Alburtus (Charles) Photograph Collection Documenting Life at Yale
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday May 3, 2019 at 07:01

did.unittitle: Charles Alburtus photograph collection documenting life at Yale

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of photographs and negatives taken by Charles Alburtus, primarily of Yale buildings, grounds, and individuals. Includes a few photographs of New Haven, Connecticut.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 48-A (YRG 48-A), Yale pictorial records and collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles Alburtus Photograph Collection Documenting Life at Yale (RU 775). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of photographs and negatives taken by Charles Alburtus, primarily of Yale buildings, grounds, and individuals. Includes a few photographs of New Haven, Connecticut.
